title: Latest Developments in Precise Correlative Cryo-FIB Milling for Cryo-ET Lamella Production
content: Correlative cryo-FIB milling is a powerful sample preparation technique for in situ cryo electron tomography (cryo-ET). Using this technique, vitrified cells can be thinned down and cellular components can be directly visualized in their native context at near-atomic resolution. In recent years several solutions have been proposed to simplify the technique by integrating fluorescent microscopes (FLM) in the cryo-FIB [1-4]. However, it remains challenging to precisely and accurately target the region of interest (ROI). Here we present a high-quality integrated fluorescent microscope, called METEOR, that allows precise and accurate targeting of the ROI.
